metadata.name: Install New Package Via Winget Local Manifest
metadata.comment: Detects usage of winget to install applications via manifest file. Adversaries can abuse winget to download payloads remotely and execute them. The manifest option enables you to install an application by passing in a YAML file directly to the client. Winget can be used to download and install exe, msi or msix files later.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\winget.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('winget.exe') AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('install')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' add '))) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('-m ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('--manifest'))))

output.summary: Detects usage of winget to install applications via manifest file. Adversaries can abuse winget to download payloads remotely and execute them. The manifest option enables you to install an application by passing in a YAML file directly to the client. Winget can be used to download and install exe, msi or msix files later.

metadata.objective: False positive: Some false positives are expected in some environment that may use this functionality to install and test their custom applications References: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/package-manager/winget/install#local-install, https://lolbas-project.github.io/lolbas/Binaries/Winget/, https://github.com/nasbench/Misc-Research/tree/b9596e8109dcdb16ec353f316678927e507a5b8d/LOLBINs/Winget
